definition: to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
to gallop/speedily/to proceed to/to pilot (ship, plane etc)/to sail
certificate/proof/to prove/to demonstrate/to confirm/variant of 症[zheng4]

sentences.english: He wanted to get a license to drive a car.
sentences.chinese: 他想办一张驾驶汽车的驾驶证。

sentences.english: You know, I have like licenses to drive commercial vehicles.
sentences.chinese: 我有驾驶证可以开商用车。

sentences.english: If he does not accept the penalty within the time limit without any justifiable reason, his motor vehicle driving license shall be revoked.
sentences.chinese: 无正当理由逾期未接受处理的，吊销机动车驾驶证。

sentences.english: Remember to bring your donor card, driver's license or two other forms of ID.
sentences.chinese: 记得带上献血证，驾驶证或其他两种身份证明。

sentences.english: In return, we will give you our driver's licenses.
sentences.chinese: 为些，我们会将我们的驾驶证给你。

sentences.english: So, before you go on driving licenses to check, in case of accidents.
sentences.chinese: 因此，出行前必须对驾驶证照进行检查，以防不测。

sentences.english: A regular driver's license is required to take the vehicle on the road, but car registration is unnecessary.
sentences.chinese: 该车上路一样需要驾驶证，但无需做车辆登记。

sentences.english: Show me your license and registration.
sentences.chinese: 给我看你的驾驶证和行车证。

sentences.english: Policeman: Can I see your license and registration?
sentences.chinese: 请出示一下驾驶证和登记证好吗？

sentences.english: When you call the violator back to your patrol car, ask him to bring the driver's license only please.
sentences.chinese: 在你叫违规者到你的巡逻车上时，让他只带上驾驶证。

definition: to renew a certificate (ID card etc)/to leave an ID at the desk to gain entrance
driving under the influence of alcohol (DUI)
drink and drive (moderately high blood alcohol concentration)
traffic police/abbr. for 交通警察
to break the rules/to violate regulations
to deduct marks (when grading school work)/to have marks deducted/penalty points/to lose points for a penalty or error
